quoridor.model

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • quoridor.model.Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Board class represents the table board. This is where the two Players are interacting (place a wall, move a pawn, ...)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Board constructor initialize the attributes (2D array of Square objects)

      • checkPosition

        public boolean checkPosition(int x1,
                             int y1,
                             int x2,
                             int y2)
        The players choose the coordinates (x and y on the grid) of the position he wants to move to. This method checks whether or not the movemenet is possible. This method could be divided into 3 sub-methods : - the one who checks if a wall is between the player and the coordinates given - the one that checks if the opponent's pawn is at the given coordinates - the one that checks if the given coordinate is outside the limits of the grid
        Parameters:
        x1 - x coordinate where the Player wants to move
        y1 - y coordinate where the Player wants to move
        x2 - x coordinate where the Player wants to move
        y2 - y coordinate where the Player wants to move
        Returns:
        true if the position is correct

      • checkWallPlacement

        public boolean checkWallPlacement(int x,
                                  int y)
        same as for the checkPosition method. we must take into account the fact that the wall is two blocks high / long, and that it can thus leave the grid even if we enter a correct coordinates in parameter. Implementation: check that the coordinates do not exceed the grid board length-1, copy the 2D array, in the new 2D array add the wall, and finally in the new grid we check that both players can still access at least one Square of the opponent
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate where the Player wants to place the wall
        y - y coordinate where the Player wants to place the wall
        Returns:
        true if the position is correct

      • BFS

        public Square BFS(int x,
                  int y)
        Pathfinding algorithm : Search if the Player can reach a position or if it is impossible
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate (origin)
        y - y coordinate (origin)
        Returns:
        if the player can reach the position, else false

      • endVerif

        public boolean endVerif(Square sq,
                        SquareType joueur)
        Check if the position of the square searched by player is the end
        Parameters:
        sq - the square to check
        joueur - color of the player
        Returns:
        true if the actual sq is the end for the player

      • verifSQ

        public java.util.ArrayList<Square> verifSQ(Square sq)
        check all coordinate of the square searched, to see if he can move to a direction, send the coordinate of these direction to an arrayList and will return it
        Parameters:
        sq - square to check
        Returns:
        the array of move that the player could do at this place

      • noWall

        public boolean noWall(int x1,
                      int y1,
                      int x2,
                      int y2)
        check if there is a wall on the grid between the (x1, y1) and (x2, y2)
        Parameters:
        x1 - first x coordinate (origin)
        y1 - first y coordinate (origin)
        x2 - second x coordinate (destination)
        y2 - second y coordinate (destination)
        Returns:
        true if there's a wall, else false

      • isFree

        public boolean isFree(int x1,
                      int y1)
        check if the type of the Square in the grid at [x][y] has a SquareType attribute equals to FREE
        Parameters:
        x1 - x1 coordinate of the Square on the grid
        y1 - y1 coordinate of the Square on the grid
        Returns:
        if the position is free, else false

      • availablePosition

        public boolean availablePosition(int x1,
                                 int y1,
                                 int x2,
                                 int y2)
        Checks if the position (x2, y2) is next to (x1, y1) and it is reacheable by the player
        Parameters:
        x1 - first x coordinate (where the Player is)
        y1 - first y coordinate (where the Player is)
        x2 - second x coordinate (where the Player wants to go)
        y2 - second y coordinate (where the Player wants to go)
        Returns:
        true if the position is available, else false

      • getGrid

        public Square[][] getGrid()
        return the table, the grid use in the all board
        Returns:
        the grid
